definition: Hexi Corridor (or Gansu Corridor), a string of oases running the length of Gansu, forming part of the Northern Silk Road
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
corridor/veranda/porch

sentences.english: Hexi corridor was named one of the commodity grain base in China and granary bam of Gansu province.
sentences.chinese: 河西走廊被誉为甘肃的粮仓和全国的商品粮基地之一。

sentences.english: Yongdeng County, which has a long history, is the gateway of the Hexi Corridor.
sentences.chinese: 永登县历史悠久，是通往河西走廊的门户。

sentences.english: The Wusun first lived in the Gansu Corridor.
sentences.chinese: 乌孙，最初活动于河西走廊。

sentences.english: Huangyang town is small town in Hexi aisle of Gansu Province.
sentences.chinese: 黄羊镇是甘肃省河西走廊的一个小镇。

sentences.english: Jiayuguan sits along one of the narrowest parts of the Hexi Corridor.
sentences.chinese: 嘉峪关所在的地方，是河西走廊最狭窄的区域之一。

definition: Yumen Pass, or Jade Gate, western frontier post on the Silk Road in the Han Dynasty, west of Dunhuang, in Gansu
Mt Qilian in Qinhai
Qilian Mountains (formerly Richthofen Range), dividing Qinghai and Gansu provinces
Western Regions (Han Dynasty term for regions beyond Yumen Pass 玉門關|玉门关[Yu4 men2 Guan1])
Zhangye prefecture level city in Gansu
Ganzhou district of Zhangye city 張掖市|张掖市[Zhang1 ye4 shi4], Gansu
Helan Mountains, lying across part of the border between Ningxia and Inner Mongolia
the Silk Road
Guanzhong plain in Shaanxi, valley of the Wei River 渭河
Inner Mongolia (lit. south of the Gobi Desert)
Guazhou county in Jiuquan 酒泉, Gansu
Jiayu Pass in Gansu, at the western terminus of the Great Wall/Jiayuguan prefecture-level city in Gansu
Dunhuang county level city in Jiuquan 酒泉, Gansu
old name for the Pamir high plateau 帕米爾高原|帕米尔高原[Pa4 mi3 er3 Gao1 yuan2] on the border between Xinjiang and Tajikistan
desert
Wuwei prefecture level city in Gansu
